FuncDef:
The clock source clock-id command configures a clock ID for a clock source.
The undo source clock-id command restores the clock ID for a clock source.
By default, the clock ID is 0.
CLIs: clock source [ chassis <chassis-id> ] { bits0 | bits1 | bits2 } clock-id <clockid-value>
clock source [ chassis <chassis-id> ] bits0 clock-id <clockid-value> [ slot <slotid> ]
undo clock source bits0 clock-id [ slot <slotid> ]
undo clock source [ chassis <chassis-id> ] { bits0 | bits1 | bits2 } clock-id
undo clock source [ chassis <chassis-id> ] bits0 clock-id [ slot <slotid> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the available slot.
The value is a string of 1 to 16 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies a chassis ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 20.

Specifies that the external BITS clock source is a BITS1 interface.
-

Specifies that the external BITS clock source is a BITS2 interface.
-

Clock ID of a clock source.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 15.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The default clock ID is 0. If you have enabled the extended SSM function for a clock source, this clock source cannot participate in clock source selection.
To enable clock IDs to participate in clock source selection, configure clock IDs for a clock sources. The participation of clock IDs prevents clock loops.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
